1.text: Mark the fabric where you want to place the eyelet.

2.text: Insert the cone punch and die base into opposite sides of the pliers.

3.text: Center the die and punch over the mark and squeeze the pliers.

4.text: Remove punch and die and insert eyelet holder and splitting punch.

5.text: Push the eyelet post through the hole in the fabric.

6.text: Squeeze the eyelet with the pliers to secure it to the fabric.

7.text: Reinforce the fabric with fusible interfacing if the fabric is light or thin.

8.text: Mark the fabric with a circle the size of the inside of the eyelet.

9.text: Cut a small, cross-shaped hole into the fabric.

10.text: Push the top eyelet piece into the hole on the right side of the fabric.

11.text: Position the bottom eyelet on a hard surface.

12.text: Place the top half of the eyelet over the bottom eyelet.

13.text: Tap the top eyelet with a rubber mallet 2 to 3 times.

14.text: Repeat the process until you’ve added the desired number of eyelets.
